definition: to follow the prescribed order; to keep to the working routine (idiom)
to press/to push/to leave aside or shelve/to control/to restrain/to keep one's hand on/to check or refer to/according to/in the light of/(of an editor or author) to make a comment
ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
surname Ban
team/class/squad/work shift/ranking/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for groups

sentences.english: For the first 2-hour block, just do what you'd normally do during that time period.
sentences.chinese: 在頭一個兩小時的時段裏，你按部就班地做事就可以。

sentences.english: I work out on a daily basis and I play racquetball in between.
sentences.chinese: 我每天按部就班地外出工作，並在閒暇時玩壁球。

sentences.english: Do you have to follow these things step-by-step?
sentences.chinese: 你必須按部就班的去做以下這些事情嗎？

sentences.english: Can you teach me the nuts and bolts of building a toolshed ?
sentences.chinese: 你能按部就班地教我怎樣蓋一間工具房嗎？

sentences.english: It will be interesting to see how this all shakes down.
sentences.chinese: 看到所有這些按部就班地實行將會很有趣。

sentences.english: If you work conscientiously you 'll only die a pauper.
sentences.chinese: 你按部就班地幹，做到老也是窮死。

definition: follow the prescribed order/keep to conventional ways
regular and thorough (idiom); methodically arranged
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
already fixed/set/established
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
to go steady and strike hard (in fighting)/fig. steadily and surely
steady/steadfast
gait/marching order/step/pace
nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable
pinyin: yi1 bu4 yi1 ge4 jiao3 yin4

definition: to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
not one thread loose (idiom); strictly according to the rules/meticulous/not one hair out of place
a wooden word-by-word reading
logical/only to be expected/rational and clearly structured (of text)
